RESERVE YOUR PLACE IN ADVANCE (AND SAVE YOURSELF $2/PERSON BY E-MAILING GBBCCDWD@YAHOO.COM and telling them you are attending or planning to attend.

We are thrilled to announce a special Dinner With Dharma presentation on Friday night, June 22.  Most Venerable Hsin Ting will be speaking on Mindful Meditation: Improving Our Emotional Intelligence.  We hope that you will mark your calendar and be able to attend this event.

Most Ven. Hsin Ting is known for his Dharma talks, instruction in Chan (Zen) meditation, construction projects, and the composition of music and lyrics.  He is revered by both monastics and devotees for his compassion, wisdom, and Buddhist chanting. He is an expert in Dharma services and rituals and travels worldwide to teach and give Dharmapresentations and lead Buddhist ceremonies. Most Ven. Hsin Ting is an elder monk of Fo Guang Shan (FGS), the Chinese, Mahayana Buddhist monastic order of which GBBCC is a branch temple.   FGS is based in Taiwan and has over 200 temples worldwide.    From 1997-2005, Most Ven. Hsin Ting was the sixth abbot of FGS.  From 2004 to 2010, he served as the president of BLIA (Buddha's Light International Organization), FGSs organization of lay people. If you are interested in attending Dinner With Dharma on June 22nd, please register by E-MAILING GBBCCDWD@YAHOO.COM before 9:00 Thursday night, June 21, 2012.  Registered participants pay $10 ($5 for students) and either $12 or $6 as a drop-in.We expect a large turnout and need to plan for dinner and seating.  The evening’s program will begin at 6:30 for meditation followed bydinner at 7:00 and Most Ven. Hsin Ting’s presentation at around 7:45.  We look forward to seeing you soon. Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center
950 Mass. Ave.
Cambridge, between Harvard and Central Squares
617-547-6670

 

 

Every 4th Friday evening is Dinner With Dharma at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge.

There's a cholesterol-free vegan buffet there that lets us maintain our trim healthy figures and enjoy the delicious food with our neighbors and new-found friends.

As SOON as we arrive in this multicultural Buddhist context, we have opportunity to speak Mandarin (or to TEST OUT our Mandarin).  The simplest suggestion is: look for the Chinese folks there and begin speaking ONLY in Mandarin.  Then chat with others - use the Mandarin you know.

http://www.GBBC.net - IF you speak and read Mandarin - This Chinese language site has a security warning, but it's known to be SAFE to visit and study.

 

http://bit.ly/GBBCC-Intro-Mandarin - Mandarin language intro to Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center in Cambridge, MA

Every 4th Friday evening is Dinner With Dharma at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge.

Adult Non-student registered in advanced with Marjorie AND this Meetup: $10

Student with ID Registered in advance with Marjorie AND thisMeetup: $5 (student ID required for the $5 half price)

7:45 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (could go on for 75 minutes - until 9 pm)

Special presentation: The (expected) FUTURE LEADER of Fo Guang Shan will speak

Hsin Ting (Chinese: 心定和尚; pinyin: Xīndìng Héshàng) (born February 2, 1944) is a Buddhist monk from Taiwan[1] who served as the sixth abbot and director of Fo Guang Shan from 1997 to 2005. He served as acting abbot for three years after the sudden death of his predecessor, the Venerable Hsin Ping, in 1995. Hsin Ting currently serves as the President of Buddha's Light International Association.

According to Fo Guang Shan's order of precedence, Hsin Ting is the third highest monastic in the order after the late Hsin Ping. Hsin Ting is expected to succeed Hsing Yun as the head teacher of Fo Guang Shan in the future. Along with Hsin Ping, he is a forty-ninth lineage holder of the Linji Chan school.

Pre-Vegan Dinner Meditation/Prayer Recited Before Eating

May palms be joined together in every world expressing kindness, compassion, joy, and giving.

May all beings find security in friendship, peace, and loving care.

May calm and mindful practice seed patience and deep equanimity.

May we give rise to spacious hearts and humble thoughts of gratitude.


We say this and we say it in translation?

Ci bei xi she bian fa jie.
Xi fu jie yuan li ren tian.
Chan jing jie heng ping deng ren.
Chan quei gan an da yuan xi.

I would like a clear English translation of the Chinese, which I think is Simplified Chinese.
Chinese Cha'an Buddhist nuns run GBBCC.

Some machine translations say:
慈悲喜舍遍法界. - Ci Beixi homes over the Dharma Realm.

吸附解原理人天. - May one day, the solution be adsorbed or taken up together.

肠镜界横屏灯人.- Colonoscopy industry landscape lightsman.

产区诶甘安大院西. - Gan security compound west areas, eh?

Surely that CANNOT be a clean, clear, and correct translation.

When we get a GOOD translation, we can remove this from the page and put here a more correct English translation of the Mandarin.
